title: Panthers rookie Lathan Ransom goes from goat to hero in one week after game-clinching interception
description: Carolina Panthers rookie safety Lathan Ransom has experienced the dramatic highs and lows of playing in the NFL in his first season.  One week after a crucial penalty that led to a costly loss to the New Orleans Saints, Ransom redeemed himself on Sunday by intercepting Baker Mayfield with 42 seconds left to seal the Panthers' 23-20 win over the Buccaneers ‚Äî allowing Carolina to vault into sole possession of first place in the NFC South.  Ransom couldn't have felt much worse last week on the flight home from New Orleans after he was flagged for hitting sliding Saints quarterback Tyler Shough with 9 seconds left on a bang-bang play.
fullText:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) ‚Äî Carolina Panthers rookie safety Lathan Ransom has experienced the dramatic highs and lows of playing in the NFL in his first season.

One week after a crucial penalty that led to a costly loss to the New Orleans Saints, Ransom redeemed himself on Sunday by intercepting Baker Mayfield with 42 seconds left to seal the Panthers' 23-20 win over the Buccaneers ‚Äî allowing Carolina to vault into sole possession of first place in the NFC South.

‚ÄúI faced a lot of adversity, and I heard noise from everybody last week,‚Äù Ransom said. ‚Äú... (But) that‚Äôs how you shake back.‚Äù

Ransom couldn't have felt much worse last week on the flight home from New Orleans after he was flagged for hitting sliding Saints quarterback Tyler Shough with 9 seconds left on a bang-bang play. Officials flagged Ransom for unnecessary roughness, and the 15-yard penalty turned a difficult 61-yard field goal attempt into a far more makable one from 46 yards.

Charlie Smyth put it through the uprights to complete the Saints' 20-17 come-from-behind win.

Had the Panthers defeated the Saints, they would have only needed to beat the Bucs on Sunday to clinch the NFC South and end a seven-year playoff drought. Instead, the loss left the Panthers on the outside of the playoff bubble.

Ransom said he was hard on himself.

But the fourth-draft pick from Ohio State decided early last week that instead of dwelling on the mistake he'd use it as motivation.

‚ÄúI understand that the game is not won or lost by one play, but people behind their phone are going to have their own opinions,‚Äù Ransom said. ‚ÄúI just heard all the noise ‚Äî listened to it and used it as fuel for this game.‚Äù

Ransom leaned on the support last week of veteran defensive leaders such as Jaycee Horn, Derrick Brown and Mike Jackson, who shares the locker next to him.

Jackson and others advised to look ahead, not back and keeping playing at full speed.

‚ÄúHe responded like a grown man should," Jackson said. ‚ÄúAt the end of day, everyone was talking trash to him, like he shouldn't be in the game and this and that. And today he responded like he should be. I'll just say I'm proud of him. Because at the end of the day it's grown man football and he showed that.‚Äù

Panthers coach Dave Canales greeted Ransom on the sideline with a huge hug after interception, and smiled as he spoke about the rookie after the game.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a great story,‚Äù Canales said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs fantastic and it‚Äôs just about belief and having confidence in our guys to be able to be studs about the things we need to work on and be studs about the different decisions that come up. I love that for Lathan ‚Äî for him to be able to make the winning play, the biggest play of the game for us.‚Äù

The Panthers will need more big plays from Ransom and other young players if they hope to dethrone the Buccaneers, who have won the last four NFC South titles.

Carolina can clinch the division with a win next week against Seattle and a Tampa Bay loss to Miami. But if the Bucs win, it will come down to a rematch in Week 18 for the division title.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve learned a bunch throughout the season, especially from that first game,‚Äù Ransom said. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre going to learn. It‚Äôs a learning process. You‚Äôre playing with the best of the best. I learn more and more every game and I try to take those teachings into the next game.‚Äù

AP NFL: https://apnews.com/hub/nfl

title: NFL playoff picture: What Texans‚Äô win over Raiders means for AFC standings in Week 16
description: The Texans face the Raiders in Houston on Sunday. We break down what the game means for the NFL playoff picture in Week 16.
fullText:
Game result: The Texans beat the Raiders, 23-21, in Week 16. Houston improves to 10-5 on the year and stays at the No. 7 seed in the AFC Playoff picture. Houston remains a game behind the Jacksonville Jaguars in the AFC South, who moved to 11-4 with their win over the Denver Broncos on Week 16.

The Houston Texans are closing in on a playoff berth, but it will be at least another week before they will have a clinching scenario. The Texans host the Las Vegas Raiders in Week 16 and this is a game they absolutely cannot lose.

The Texans are 9-5 and have won six straight in a streak that has included wins over the Jaguars, Bills, Colts, and Chiefs. They beat the Cardinals 40-20 last week. The Texans face a Raiders squad that is 2-12 and has lost eight straight games. Last week, the Raiders were thumped by the Eagles 31-0 in Philly.

Houston is a 14.5-point favorite, which is the biggest spread of Week 16.

The Texans are in second place in the division sitting one game back of the Jaguars. Houston and Jacksonville split their season series and the Texans have a half game lead for the divisional tiebreaker (4-1 vs. 3-1). The Jaguars are traveling to face the Broncos this weekend, so if they lose that but win their two remaining games, the tiebreaker would go to record in common games.

Meanwhile, the Colts sit a game back of the Texans and still has one game left with them. Houston won the first game in Week 13. The Colts need to see the Texans lose in Week 16 or 17 to create a situation in which the Colts can finish ahead of them.

The Texans are in seventh place and hold the final wild card spot ahead of the 8-6 Colts and 7-7 Ravens. If the Texans win and the Colts lose, Houston would have a wild card clinching scenario in Week 17 when they travel to face the Chargers. The Texans enter Week 16 with a 98% chance of making the playoffs at The Athletic‚Äôs playoff simulator. Houston has a 58% chance of claiming a wild card berth and a 40% chance of winning the division.

The Raiders are a common opponent for the Texans and Jaguars. There is a very real chance the Texans and Jaguars finish tied and it common opponents. They are also a common opponent with the Chargers, but Houston and LA will have a head-to-head tiebreaker sorted out when they meet in Week 17.

title: Jason Pierre-Paul is back with Bucs so nice guys don‚Äôt finish last
description: Jason Pierre-Paul will be 37 on New Year‚Äôs Day, hasn‚Äôt played in an NFL game in two years or produced more than three sacks in any season since helping the Bucs win Super Bowl 55 following the 2020 season. When Tampa Bay signed him to its practice squad on Dec.
fullText:
Jason Pierre-Paul will be 37 on New Year‚Äôs Day, hasn‚Äôt played in an NFL game in two years or produced more than three sacks in any season since helping the Bucs win Super Bowl 55 following the 2020 season.

When Tampa Bay signed him to its practice squad on Dec. 9, it wasn‚Äôt just to put pressure on opposing quarterbacks. The team felt it could use him to put heat on some of its own players on defense.

Buy FIRE THE CANNONS: 50 Years of Tampa Bay Buccaneers Football

The Bucs didn‚Äôt just need an edge rusher. They needed an edge, someone whose passion might boil over into an opponent‚Äôs penalty. A teammate they would watch with a side-eye, never fully sure what he might do next. A player who made opponents uncomfortable and injected an attitude the locker room couldn‚Äôt manufacture.

In addition to an overall lack of consistent pressure from their defensive line and outside linebacker positions, the Bucs lack someone teammates are afraid to let down.

Think about the best Bucs teams from the past. The Super Bowl 37 champions were stuffed with those kinds of players on defense. Warren Sapp. Even safety John Lynch, who is about as even-tempered off the field as anyone you will ever meet, was borderline maniacal between the lines. He knocked his brother-in-law (Bears tight end John Allred) out cold in a 1997 game at Soldier Field.

Hardy Nickerson was that guy when Lynch, Sapp and Derrick Brooks arrived.

It also helps that Pierre-Paul has a resume. He owns 94 ¬Ω career sacks and 21 forced fumbles. Outside linebacker Yaya Diaby leads the Bucs with only six sacks this season.

Less than two weeks after Pierre-Paul was signed to the practice squad, Diaby says he‚Äôs benefited from the two-time Super Bowl champion‚Äôs counsel.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been good so far, man,‚Äù Diaby said. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt even lie. He‚Äôs very intentional with what he‚Äôs done and what he sees that we‚Äôve been doing that he can improve upon. Even for me, he‚Äôll come up and say, ‚ÄòThis is what you can do to get off real faster. You could‚Äôve done this or done that.‚Äô

‚ÄúSo, he‚Äôs been real intentional in trying to share whatever he can. Even (Wednesday), he was telling me, ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt know everything. But what I do know, I can help you with that.‚Äù

On Saturday, Pierre-Paul was elevated from the practice squad for Sunday‚Äôs game at Carolina. Head coach Todd Bowles had said earlier in the week that Pierre-Paul was ‚Äúin play‚Äù for the NFC South showdown, even with no players forced to miss the game due to injury.

‚ÄúI think he‚Äôs coming in and getting back acclimated systematically in some of the things we‚Äôre asking him to do,‚Äù defensive pass game coordinator George Edwards. ‚ÄúBut I think he‚Äôs been very attentive. It‚Äôs bought into calling some of the plays he‚Äôs done in the past. He‚Äôs here working hard, so we‚Äôll see how it goes. You never know when your number is called to be in those situations.‚Äù

Pierre-Paul‚Äôs energy and passion for the game is infectious, Diaby said.

‚ÄúHe loves it, and he‚Äôs still got some juice,‚Äù Diaby said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs still got some juice.‚Äù

There‚Äôs been far too many miscommunications on the Bucs defense this season. Much of it is on the players. Some of it is opponents going fast to prevent an array of blitzes and coverages to be communicated before the snap.

It‚Äôs one of the reasons why there have been so many missed assignments, a player out of position here or there because the communication breaks down.

Bowles always has been known for the complexity of his defense and the ability to disguise an array of blitzes. But those take time to communicate.

Consequently, opponents are getting to or staying on the ball quickly between snaps.

‚ÄúOn third down, they speed it up some,‚Äù Bowles said. ‚ÄúWe expect that. We‚Äôve been getting that for the last two years. We have to have calls ready. We understand that, and we do have calls ready. We expect to get sped up some.‚Äù

The Bucs and Panthers are both 5-1 in games decided by three points or less this season.

What makes them able to execute in pressure situations?

‚Äúit‚Äôs just playing smart football,‚Äù Bowles said. ‚ÄùWe have to play smart football, and you can‚Äôt beat yourselves and you‚Äôve got to execute.‚Äù

Every weekday, tune into our Sports Day Tampa Bay podcast to hear reporter Rick Stroud break down the biggest stories in Tampa Bay sports.

Never miss out on the latest with your favorite Tampa Bay sports teams. Follow our coverage on X and Facebook.

title: Browns vs. Bills radio coverage: Station, channel, streaming to listen live to NFL Week 16 game broadcast
description: Buffalo is closing in on a playoff spot.
fullText:
Browns vs. Bills radio coverage: Station, channel, streaming to listen live to NFL Week 16 game broadcast originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Buffalo Bills‚Äô dramatic Week 15 victory over the New England Patriots was far more than a simple rivalry win; it was a season-saving, division-defining statement.

Trailing 21-0 in the first half at Gillette Stadium, quarterback Josh Allen led the Bills on a historic comeback, scoring five consecutive touchdowns to erase the deficit and secure the thrilling 35-31 win. The victory was crucial, as it prevented the Patriots from clinching the AFC East title on their home turf and kept Buffalo's own slim division hopes mathematically alive heading into the final three weeks of the season.

More importantly for their immediate postseason aspirations, that massive win cemented the Bills (10-4) as the leading Wild Card contender in the highly competitive AFC playoff picture. Currently holding the No. 6 seed, Buffalo‚Äôs favorable tiebreakers give them a strong foothold as they enter a demanding closing schedule. With the Los Angeles Chargers and Houston Texans nipping at their heels, maintaining momentum is essential to avoid being dragged back into the desperate fight for the final playoff spots.

That urgency brings the Bills to Cleveland this Sunday for a pivotal matchup against the Browns (3-11). While Cleveland has struggled through a disappointing season, their defense ‚Äîled by the perennial Defensive Player of the Year candidate Myles Garrett ‚Äîremains highly disruptive. The quarterback battle is one to watch: Shedeur Sanders will make his fifth NFL start against the reigning MVP in Josh Allen.

Ultimately, Sunday's clash at Huntington Bank Field is an absolute "must-win" for Buffalo. Having survived the biggest challenge of their season by battling back against the Patriots, the Bills cannot afford a letdown against a struggling opponent if they want to secure their spot in the postseason for a seventh straight year. A win would keep the pressure squarely on New England in the AFC East race and put Buffalo on the very brink of officially punching their ticket as the top team in the AFC Wild Card standings.

title: Patriots playoff picture: Rooting guide for Week 16 games around NFL
description: Who Patriots fans should be rooting for in Week 16 of the 2025 NFL season.
fullText:
The New England Patriots will try to get back into the win column this week versus the Baltimore Ravens. Naturally, all of our attention is on that particular Sunday night matchup. That said, some of the other 15 games around the NFL this week are also worth keeping a close eye on.

With that said, welcome to this week‚Äôs Patriots rooting guide.

As a disclaimer, we are looking at games through two primary lenses: New England‚Äôs chances of winning the division ‚Äî which they cannot do this week ‚Äî as well as earning the No. 1 seed in the AFC. Naturally and given the tiebreaker situation, not every game will be equally important even if it involves common opponents or other teams in the conference or division.

The Patriots were entering the weekend with a 73% chance of winning the division, according to The Athletic, and are 99+% favorite to make the playoffs (they actually can punch their ticket on Sunday). Their odds for the No. 1 seed are not nearly as good and a mere 10% at the moment.

Tampa Bay Buccaneers (7-7) at Carolina Panthers (7-7): Go good game! Division supremacy on the line, but the Patriots do not care who will win this one. | FOX

Buffalo Bills (10-4) at Cleveland Browns (3-11): Go Browns! The Patriots won‚Äôt lock up the division this week either way, but Buffalo dropping this one would give them more wiggle room: if the Bills lose and they beat the Ravens, the Patriots would be up two games with two weeks to go. | CBS

Los Angeles Chargers (10-4) at Dallas Cowboys (6-7-1): Go Cowboys! The Chargers entering the competition for the No. 1 seed in the AFC is unlikely but not entirely impossible. This is merely based on keeping another competitor away from the race for the first-round bye in the conference. | FOX

Cincinnati Bengals (4-10) at Miami Dolphins (6-8): Go Dolphins! Miami is out of the playoffs, so all wins do over the last three weeks is further weaken the team‚Äôs draft position. | CBS

New York Jets (3-11) at New Orleans Saints (4-10): Go Jets! This is the same we talked about with the Dolphins, namely that the Jets adding some more wins down the stretch would end up hurting their draft stock. | CBS

Minnesota Vikings (6-8) at New York Giants (2-12): Go good game! This all-NFC matchup has no impact on the Patriots. | FOX

Kansas City Chiefs (6-8) at Tennessee Titans (2-12): Go Titans! The more games the Chiefs end up losing, the better for New England: they own a Kansas City sixth-rounder next year courtesy of the Joshua Uche trade. The worse their record, the better positioned the pick. | CBS

Atlanta Falcons (5-9) at Arizona Cardinals (3-11): Go good game! Nothing to see here, really. | FOX

Jacksonville Jaguars (10-4) at Denver Broncos (12-2): Go Jaguars! This is a big one. If the Patriots want to take over the No. 1 seed in the AFC, they will need Denver to start losing some games. This one against the red hot Jaguars is a realistic candidate. | FOX

Pittsburgh Steelers (8-6) at Detroit Lions (8-6): Go Lions! The Steelers missing out on the playoffs would be good news for the Patriots and the sixth-round draft pick they received as part of the Kyle Dugger trade. Obviously, in an ideal scenario, Pittsburgh would still be ahead of the Ravens after Week 16, but a loss here would keep the chances intact of Baltimore eventually leap-frogging their division rivals and pushing them out of postseason contention. | CBS

Las Vegas Raiders (2-12) at Houston Texans (9-5): Go good game! Even though this is a game between two AFC teams, including one competing for a playoff spot, the game has no real impact on New England. | CBS

San Francisco 49ers (10-4) at Indianapolis Colts (8-6): Go Colts! We end the week with a focus on draft positioning. In the unlikely case the 49ers drop out of the playoff picture in the NFC, the Patriots would benefit: the conditional sixth-round pick acquired in the Keion White trade would be better positioned in that case. | ESPN

The following games have taken place earlier in the week:

Los Angeles Rams (11-3) at Seattle Seahawks (11-3): Go good game! Given the stakes, this is one of the top Thursday night games in recent memories. And while it has no impact on the Patriots, it should be a fun watch nonetheless. | LA 37, SEA 38 (OT)

Philadelphia Eagles (9-5) at Washington Commanders (4-10): Go good game! A no-impact game from a Patriots perspective. | PHI 29, WAS 18

Green Bay Packers (9-4-1) at Chicago Bears (10-4): Go Packers! While the game won‚Äôt change New England‚Äôs playoff outlook, it could end up impacting the draft. The Patriots, after all, own the Bears‚Äô fourth-round pick sent to them by the Chiefs as part of an in-draft trade last year. | GB 16, CHI 22 (OT)

This article also serves as an open thread for this week‚Äôs games. Please head down to the comment section to discuss and share your thoughts on the games as they unfold.

title: Best NFL players ever on the worst teams: Myles Garrett, Calvin Johnson and the 16 most wasted talents in history
description: These 16 NFL players are among football's all-time greats, but their teams were anything but.
fullText:
Best NFL players ever on the worst teams: Myles Garrett, Calvin Johnson and the 16 most wasted talents in history originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Cleveland edge rusher Myles Garrett is on the edge of making NFL history.

Garrett ‚Äì who has 21.5 sacks ‚Äì can tie the NFL single-season sack record held by former Giants star Michael Strahan and Steelers edge rusher T.J Watt with his next sack. Garrett, of course, is playing for the Browns ‚Äì who have been eliminated from the AFC playoff race.

That's going to beg the question: Is Garrett the best player on the worst team in NFL history? We're not just talking about this year. We're talking for the entirety of their career.

Sporting News identified 16 NFL stars ‚Äì including eight Pro Football Hall of Fame players ‚Äì who fit that description. We ranked those players based on four categories, including worst team winning percentage, playoff appearances (fewest scored higher), Pro Bowl selections (highest to lowest) and NFL MVP or AP Defensive Player of the Year Awards. In the event of a tie, the player whose teams had a lower winning percentage wen

This balances the great player vs. how good, or in this case bad, their team was.

Garrett is in the top 10 along with another active edge rusher in the NFL. Who else made the list? A look at the 16 best NFL players on the worst teams.

MORE:Tracking Myles Garrett's NFL single-season sacks record chase

Teams: Saints (1999-2001), Dolphins (2002-03, 2005, 2007-10), Ravens (2011)

Williams ‚Äì who rushed for 10,009 yards ‚Äì had a rough start in New Orleans. He played for seven different head coaches ‚Äì ranging from Mike Ditka to Nick Saban ‚Äì retired for a year and was suspended for another. Williams played on a 3-13 team in New Orleans and a 1-15 team in Miami.

Teams: Buccaneers (1987-92), Browns (1993-95), Ravens (1996-97), Jets (1998-2003, 2005), Cowboys (2004), Patriots (2006), Panthers (2007)

Team playoff record: 4‚Äì3 (2-3 as a starter)

The Buccaneers were 28-67 in six seasons after selecting Testaverde with the No. 1 pick in the 1987 NFL Draft. Testaverde was 23-25 in three seasons with Bill Belichick in Cleveland. He spent two seasons in Baltimore before the best stretch of his career with the Jets and made a start in the 1998 AFC championship game against Denver. Testaverde reunited with Bill Parcells in Dallas and Belichick in New England late in his career. He finished with a 90-123-1 record as a starter with 46,233 yards, which ranks 18th on the all-time list.

Teams: Bengals (1996-2007), Ravens (2008)

Anderson ‚Äì a four-time Pro Bowl selection ‚Äì played for four different coaches during the late 1990s and early 2000s "Bungles" era, and he played on just one winning team in 12 seasons with the franchise. Anderson played in one playoff game ‚Äì a heart-breaking 31-17 loss to the Steelers in the AFC Wild Card round. Anderson did reach the AFC championship game with rival Balti

Teams: Colts (1983-89), Falcons (1990-93), Vikings (1994-95)

Hinton ‚Äì a seven-time Pro Bowl selection ‚Äì was the player the Colts got in the John Elway trade. Hinton was a mainstay at tackle, but the Colts had four straight losing seasons after his arrival. Hinton played in four playoff games in his career, which also had stints with the Falcons and Vikings. He probably deserves more Pro Football Hall of Fame consideration.

Sanders ‚Äì who ranks fourth all time in NFL history with 15,269 yards ‚Äì played on decent teams. Detroit had a winning record in five of his 10 seasons and made the NFC championship game in 1991. Sanders abruptly retired in 1998 after the Lions finished 5-11 in 1998. Sanders' highlight reel has been passed down a few generations ‚Äì but he never played in a Super Bowl.

Teams: Rams (2004-12), Falcons (2013-14), Patriots (2015)

Jackson played on some miserable teams in St. Louis. The Rams averaged three wins per season from 2007-11 ‚Äì a stretch in which Jackson had five straight 1,000-yard seasons. He finished his career with 11,438 rushing yards, and one of his two career playoff victories was in an abbreviated final season with the Patriots in 2015.

Sayers had a brief-but-brilliant career with the Bears, which was cut short by injuries. Sayers played for George Halas for four seasons ‚Äì a stretch where Chicago compiled a 28-25-3 record. He led the NFL in rushing with 236 carries for 1,032 yards and eight TDs in 1969, a season in which the Bears finished 1-13.

Teams: Saints (1993-2001); Chiefs (2002-05)

Roaf was a dominant tackle in the NFL for the Saints ‚Äì and he played for three head coaches in Jim Mora, Mike Ditka and Jim Haslett. New Orleans won one playoff game ‚Äì a 34-24 victory against St. Louis in the NFC Wild Card round ‚Äì on Dec. 30, 2000. He played four seasons with Kansas City ‚Äì including two winning teams ‚Äì to end his career.

Teams: Jaguars (2006-13), Raiders (2014)

Jones-Drew helped Jacksonville reach the AFC divisional playoffs in his second season, but it went downhill from there despite a successful career in which he finished with 8,167 rushing yards in nine seasons. MJD played on teams that won an average of three games in his final three seasons between Jacksonville and Oakland.

Stephen R. Sylvanie-Imagn Images

Crosby ‚Äì who has 69.5 career sacks ‚Äì has been with the franchise since the move from Oakland to Las Vegas. He has endured four straight losing seasons with the Raiders and has played for three coaches in each of the last three seasons. Yet Crosby remains on a trajectory that would get him to the Pro Football Hall of Fame.

The Browns went 0-16 in Garrett's first season, so it's technically been uphill from there. Garrett has played for the same coach for six seasons in Kevin Stefanski, and the Browns did beat the Steelers 48-37 in the AFC Wild Card round on Jan. 10, 2021. It hasn't been all bad for the former No. 1 pick.

Johnson never played on a team that won a playoff game. Detroit finished 0-16 in his second season, but "Megatron" continued to produce at a ridiculous level. The six-time Pro Bowl selection had 122 catches for a single-season record 1,964 receiving yards in 2012. Detroit had two winning seasons in nine years with Johnson on the field.

Kennedy ‚Äì an eight-time Pro Bowl selection ‚Äì never played on a team that won 10 games or 

You can't think about the Tampa Bay creamsicle jerseys without Selmon, the six-time Pro Bowl selection who dominated at defensive tackle for the Bucs despite some woeful teams. Tampa Bay went 0-14 in Selmon's rookie season, and they lost 10 or more games six times in his nine seasons.

Butkus ‚Äì arguably the most-feared defensive player of his era ‚Äì was on the same teams as Gale Sayers, but the linebacker played two more seasons. Butkus made the Pro Bowl eight times in eight seasons before his final year, in which he played just nine games. He also finished in the top five in the NFL MVP voting twice despite playing for teams that finished with records of 8-8 and 7-9, respectively.

Thomas is the easiest choice here. He was a 10-time Pro Bowl selection in Cleveland despite a cast of revolving door of quarterbacks and coaches through one of the most-unstable periods for any franchise in NFL history. Cleveland went 10-6 in Thomas' first season. The Browns never won more than five games over the next 10 years, and Thomas' final season was the 0-16 year in 2017. Despite that, Thomas remains one of the most-beloved athletes in Cleveland sports history.

title: Cowboys eliminated from NFL playoffs in Week 16 and you can blame the Eagles
description: The Dallas Cowboys have officially been eliminated from playoff contention.
fullText:
The Dallas Cowboys have been eliminated from playoff contention.

You may have felt that this was the case for some time already in a matter of fact sense, but it became official on Saturday night when the Philadelphia Eagles beat the Washington Commanders. Thanks to losses over the last two weeks to the Detroit Lions and Minnesota Vikings the Cowboys left themselves with only one path into the postseason and that was as the hypothetical winner of the NFC East. That will not come to pass as the Eagles have now won it.

Much is always made about how the NFC East has not featured a back-to-back champion since 2003 and 2004 when the Eagles did it themselves. They have put that all to an end by doing it once more and on the subject of streaks the Cowboys now have one going themselves as far as playoff absences are concerned.

Dallas missed the playoffs last year, they were eliminated around the same time as it happened on December 22nd, which means they have missed the postseason for two years in a row for the first time since 2019 and 2020. Then, like now, the Cowboys were in the final year of one head coach (Jason Garrett) and the first of another (Mike McCarthy). It is almost like that is not necessarily a recipe for success.

There is a lot of introspection that is necessary from the Cowboys these days and their current playoff drought is representative of that. We talk often about how this team hasn‚Äôt been the same since they were bounced from the 2023 Wild Card Round and obviously the evidence here speaks for that as well.

We now know conclusively that there are only 3 games left on the season for the Cowboys. We also know that their drought for Super Bowl and/or NFC Championship Game appearances (the drought that Stephen Jones didn‚Äôt understand to exist) will officially grow to 30 years. It is not an approximation or a rounding up.

title: NFL Player Prop Picks: Week 16 Best Bets
description: Rohit Ponnaiya breaks down his favorite Week 16 NFL player props, including Jacoby Brissett and Aaron Rodgers.
fullText:
It's going to be a Blue Christmas for Tua Tagovailoa, who has been benched by the Dolphins. With Miami breaking in a rookie QB, my NFL props are betting on RB De'Von Achane to carry the offense.

See why I'm backing Achane, Jacoby Brissett, and Aaron Rodgers with my favorite NFL player props for Week 16 in the NFL.

Kyler Murray who? Jacoby Brissett gone over his passing yards total in all nine of his starts this season. He has thrown the ball at least 40 times in six straight contests, averaging a whopping 45.7 pass attempts per game over that span.

The Arizona Cardinals have struggled to run the ball and have practically abandoned that part of their offense. They are second in the NFL in passing play percentage (65.4%), with that number ballooning to 72.5% over the last six weeks.

The Cardinals are hosting the Atlanta Falcons on Sunday in a beautiful 76-degree day at State Farm Stadium. That should lead to plenty of throwing from a pair of teams with nothing to play for except pride.

With the Miami Dolphins starting seventh-round rookie Quinn Ewers at QB expect them to lean on their rushing attack against a piss-poor Bengals run defense. Cincinnati is 30th in the NFL in defensive rush EPA and allows a league-high 157.9 rushing yards per game.

Even if the Bengals sell out to stop the run, they won't be able to contain Achane. They allow 5.0 yards per carry when stacking the box, and De'Von Achane averages 5.8 yards per attempt when running against a stacked box.

Achane is coming off a game where he was limited to 60 yards on 12 carries due to a negative game script.¬†However, he had rushed for more than 90 yards in his previous four contests, averaging 130.0 rushing yards per game over that span.

Aaron Rodgers is coming off back-to-back contests where he completed 23 passes in wins against the Dolphins and Ravens. The four-time MVP is proving that he still has something left in the tank, and he faces a struggling Detroit Lions pass defense in Week 16.

The Lions are 25th in the league in dropback EPA since Week 9. Their injury-depleted secondary is getting picked apart with Detroit allowing 24.3 completions per game over the last three contests.

With the Lions 7-point faves on Sunday, expect a negative game script for the Pittsburgh Steelers with plenty of passing. Rodgers has completed more than 20.5 passes in six of his last nine games and should eclipse that number again.

After a red-hot start to the season, Jacksonville Jaguars running back Travis Etienne Jr. has cooled off. Etienne has logged fewer than 60 rushing yards in six of his last 10 games and is averaging just 3.8 yards per carry over that span.

He was held to fewer than 35 rushing yards and less than 3.0 ypa in two of his last three games. What's especially concerning about those numbers is that they came with a positive game script against terrible Titans and Jets defenses.

He'll have a much tougher time in Week 16 against a Denver stop unit that allows the second-fewest rushing yards per game (90.9) on 3.9 yards per carry. Etienne is at his best on outside zone runs, where he averages 6.9 yards per rush. However, the Broncos allow just 3.3 yards per rush on outside zone attempts.

New Orleans Saints wideout Chris Olave reeled in six catches for 85 yards last week. He has logged at least 62 receiving yards in six of his last nine games, and he's finally getting good quarterback play with Tyler Shough under center.

Olave gets a mouth-watering matchup this week at home against the New York Jets, who traded away top corner Sauce Gardner at the deadline. The Jets are 31st in the league in defensive dropback EPA while ranking 28th in DVOA against No. 1 WRs.

Olave has been the Saints' only reliable pass catcher after they traded Rashid Shaheed and Brandin Cooks, so expect him to get fed the ball. This is a five-star play according to EV Analytics, which is projecting 71.57 yards for Olave.

Brissett o37.5 pass attempts (-120)

Rodgers o20.5 completions (-138)

Etienne u60.5 rush yards (-114)

Olave o61.5 receiving yards (-114)

My NFL weekly props column is 39-31 this season for +3.86 units.

Odds are correct at the time of publishing and are subject to change.

title: Cardinals Trey McBride sets two NFL records
description: Talented tight end has a season full of league records
fullText:
This 2025 NFL season hasn‚Äôt been what was expected from the Arizona Cardinals. In a division full of some of the league‚Äôs best ballclubs, the Cardinals aren‚Äôt one of them.

But there are silver linings. And with some, you don‚Äôt have to look too hard. Arizona tight end Trey McBride might be this year‚Äôs brightest star on the roster. He has already set one league record several weeks ago, and now this past weekend, he set two more.

In the Cardinals‚Äô 40-20 loss to the Houston Texans this past Sunday, McBride had 12 receptions for 134 yards and scored two touchdowns to lead all pass catchers.

Among the flow of the game, McBride set two records: 1) ‚ÄúMost consecutive games by a tight end with five or more catches,‚Äù and 2) ‚ÄúFirst tight end in NFL history to have 100 catches or 

With the first record, McBride now has 16 consecutive games, which broke the record of 15 held by Travis Kelce of the Kansas City Chiefs in 2018.

Last year, McBride caught 111 passes for 1,146 yards. He now has 105 passes for 1,071 this season with three games remaining.

McBride can now set his sights on the NFL record for ‚ÄúMost receptions by a tight end in a single season.‚Äù The record is 116 catches set by former Cardinal Zack Ertz in 2018 while he was playing for the Philadelphia Eagles. Needing an even dozen in three games shouldn‚Äôt be an issue for McBride.

He is currently ranked #1 in receptions in the league, #2 in targets, #3 in touchdowns, #4 in first down conversions, #6 in total yards gained, and #25 in pass completions of 20+ yards.

Two weeks ago, McBride broke the NFL record for the ‚ÄúMost receptions by a tight end in his first four seasons in the league.‚Äù The old record was set by tight end Jimmy Graham, who had 3,863 yards on 301 receptions. Against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in Week 13, McBride led all receivers with eight catches for 82 yards and a touchdown, and finished with 309 career receptions. He has since added to that total.

title: Major injuries could force Steelers rookie into first NFL start
description: Steelers rookie OLB Jack Sawyer could make his NFL start as T.J. Watt (lung) and Nick Herbig (hamstring) may miss the Week 16 game against the Lions.
fullText:

On Thursday, T.J. Watt (lung) and Nick Herbig (hamstring) missed their second consecutive practices and appear to be trending toward missing Sunday‚Äôs game against Detroit. This would leave Sawyer and Alex Highsmith as the starters on defense, with DeMarvin Leal serving as the backup OLB.

Alex Highsmith leads the drill, followed by Jack Sawyer, DeMarvin Leal, Jeremiah Moon and Julius Welchoff pic.twitter.com/WNCan8Hxe7

Recovering from surgery to repair a partially collapsed lung, Watt missed last week‚Äôs matchup versus the Miami Dolphins. Herbig suffered his hamstring injury against Miami and was replaced by Sawyer in the win.

We‚Äôll learn more about Watt and Herbig‚Äôs availability during Friday‚Äôs practice, but it appears Sawyer will be challenged with taking on the Lions‚Äô offensive line in his first potential career start this Sunday.

title: Cincinnati Bengals 2026 NFL Draft prospects to watch during the opening round of the college football playoffs
description: Dillon Thieneman could be an upgrade for Cincinnati at safety.
fullText:
With the College Football Playoff kicking off, here are some of the most notable NFL Draft prospects to watch for this weekend.

Alabama against Oklahoma is a rematch from earlier this season. Oklahoma pulled out a close victory against the Crimson Tide 23 to 21 in that game. I expect this game to come right down to the wire once again. We have previously discussed some Alabama prospects like Kadyn Proctor, Tim Keenan III, Deontae Lawson, and Keon Sabb. The Cincinnati Bengals could be looking to add a cornerback to replace Cam Taylor-Britt going into next year. Alabama‚Äôs Domani Jackson could be a player who intrigues the Bengals. He feels like a player that could go anywhere from rounds three to five during the draft this year. While he hasn‚Äôt had the season that many expected, he is still a solid draft prospect. He is expected to run a 4.3 40-yard dash or potentially even lower. Jackson is a great athlete with return ability, an excellent run defender, and rarely misses a tackle. He has an incredible 2.6% missed tackle rate on the 2025 season.

Domani Jackson (Alabama CB #1)
-Uses his long frame to force receivers off of their route and disrupt timing of the play
-Shows scheme flexibility and is capable in both man and zone coverage
-Has moments where his build and toughness align effectively as a true bump and run‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/CYIsf4ShLT

‚Äî Owen Denny (@OwenDennyNFL) December 4, 2025

Oklahoma has a plethora of defensive talent that should be of interest to the Bengals. We have mentioned previously R.Mason Thomas, Robert Spears-Jennings, Kip Lewis, and Gracen Halton. Another player on that defense worth mentioning for the 2026 NFL Draft is Damonic Williams. Williams is a day three space eating defensive tackle. Williams is listed at 6‚Äô1‚Äù and 323 pounds. He does his best work as a run defender in the middle of the Sooners defense. Williams originally spent a couple of seasons playing for TCU.

Damonic Williams about to wreck SEC O-Lines! üò§
 pic.twitter.com/veDDTDhX1n

‚Äî The Main Line (@TheMainLinePod) May 3, 2024

Texas A&M has a lot of talent in the trenches on both sides of the ball. Cashius Howell, Tyler Onyedim, and Albert Regis headline the defensive line. On the offensive line they are loaded with draft-elibile talent like Trey Zuhn III, Dametrious Crownover, Chase Bisontis, and Ar‚Äômaj Reed-Adams. If the Bengals decide to not re-sign Dalton Risner, they may look once again toward the draft for a right guard. While that isn‚Äôt a guarantee with Jalen Rivers here, it is at least worth mentioning. Reed-Adams is a right guard prospect that could come in and compete to start early. He is a mauling presence on the interior that loves to finish plays, sometimes to his own detriment with penalties. That type of nasty is something this Cincinnati team is missing.

Ar‚Äômaj Reed-Adams is a DAWG at Right Guard (even took some Right Tackle snaps in this one) pic.twitter.com/tmBzRySVIh

‚Äî Bengals & Brews (@BengalsBrews) May 8, 2025

Miami is equally as impressive on both sides of the ball in the trenches. On offense, they have Francis Mauigoa, Markel Bell, Anez Cooper, and James Brockermyer. On the defensive line they have Rueben Bain Jr., Ahmad Moten Sr., and Akheem Mesidor. Mesidor is an older prospect that will be turning 25 years old. We have seen previously with the pick of Demetrius Knight Jr., that age may not scare the Bengals off from taking an older guy on day two. Mesidor has 30 career sacks between his time at West Virginia and Miami. When healthy, he is an explosive pass rusher with a quick first step and a variety of pass rush moves in his arsenal. He has a 29.9% win rate on true pass sets during the 2025 season.

Akheem Mesidor (#3) Miami vs. Notre Dame ‚Äì Mesidor will turn 25 years old in April and has put up 7 sacks, 43 pressures, and 4 forced fumbles so far this season. 

At 6‚Äô3‚Äù 280 pounds he offers inside and outside versatility along the defensive line. He is a high effort player,‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/gZ8wqkZ7aS

‚Äî Bengals & Brews (@BengalsBrews) November 26, 2025

Ole Miss will be entering this game without former head coach Lane Kiffin. Kiffin will not be coaching in the playoffs after taking the LSU job. Ole Miss still has a ton of talented players and should easily handle Tulane this weekend. Zxavian Harris is a big-bodied defensive tackle I have previously discussed. They also have Dae‚Äôquan Wright, Harrison Wallace III, and De‚ÄôZhaun Stribling as offensive weapons. Another player that continues to intrigue me is Suntarine Perkins. The Bengals have tried to use Demetrius Knight Jr. as a player that can come off the edge at times with limited results. While Knight did put up two sacks this week, it was while playing the role of a spy on Lamar Jackson. If they want a player with real pass rush juice from the linebacker position, Perkins may be there guy. Perkins had 10.5 sacks last season while playing more on the edge. This year, he has just two sacks but has shown that he can play more as an off-ball linebacker, which he needed to do at only 6‚Äô1‚Äù 210 pounds.

Ole Miss's Suntarine Perkins might be my favorite prospect I watched all summer. Can't remember someone his size (6-1, 210) playing on the line of scrimmage in a major conference and still being a difference maker. 

Don't care where he plays, I want him on my football team pic.twitter.com/EAjzxQJC8Q

‚Äî Mike Renner (@mikerenner_) July 30, 2025

For Tulane, there really isn‚Äôt much to talk about for the draft. Quarterback Jake Retzlaff is a transfer from BYU that might get a camp invitation. He is unlikely to be on a roster in the NFL next year. The best prospect for them is defensive tackle/defensive end Santana Hopper, but it sounds like he will be entering the transfer portal and remaining in college football next year.

Tulane first-team all-conference DL Santana Hopper is expected to enter the transfer portal following the College Football Playoff, sources tell @On3sports. 

Has 13 career sacks. https://t.co/wMrfFrcNOy pic.twitter.com/rOyVZFN4v7

‚Äî Pete Nakos (@PeteNakos) December 16, 2025

Another contest that is likely to be heavily one sided features Oregon taking on James Madison. Oregon has a ton of draft-eligible talent including Dante Moore (QB), Noah Whittington (RB), Kenyon Sadiq (TE), Isaiah World (OT), Alex Harkey (OT), Emmanuel Pregnon (OG), Iapani Laloulu (OC), Matayo Uiagalelei (DE), Bear Alexander (DT), A‚ÄôMauri Washington (DT), Bryce Boettcher (LB), Jadon Canady (CB), and Dillon Thieneman (S). Thieneman is the most likely player that could end up a Cincinnati Bengal. The rangy safety prospect has good straight-line speed and has been highly productive for both Purdue and Oregon during his time in college football.

Dillon Thieneman vs. Indiana pic.twitter.com/WEel3shdxI

‚Äî Bengals & Brews (@BengalsBrews) November 20, 2025

Similar to Tulane, there really isn‚Äôt much for James Madison as far as draft prospects for this year. Wayne Knight is probably the best prospect on their team. However, the running back is listed at just 5‚Äô7‚Äù. He is listed at weighing around 190 pounds and has shown impressive contact balance. Knight has rushed for almost 1300 yards in 2025. He has also added almost 400 more yards as a receiver. Knight will have to play out of his mind against Oregon for James Madison to even keep this one close.

Just incredible contact balance from James Madison‚Äôs Wayne Knight to pop through here.

He‚Äôs top three in the Sun Belt in rushing yards after contact pic.twitter.com/6IELz0SmUM

‚Äî Bobby Football (@Rob__Paul) December 6, 2025

title: Seahawks in play-offs with overtime win over Rams
description: The Seattle Seahawks come from behind to beat the Los Angeles Rams in overtime and ensure they will join the Rams in this season's NFL play-offs.
fullText:
The Seattle Seahawks came from behind to beat the Los Angeles Rams in overtime and ensure they will join the Rams in this season's NFL play-offs.

The Seahawks fought back from 30-14 down in the fourth quarter to win 38-37 in Seattle and register their fifth straight victory.

The Rams were the first team to earn a post-season spot on Sunday while the Seahawks will return to the play-offs after a two-year absence.

The Seahawks have also replaced the Rams at the top of their Conference standings with a 12-3 record and, as they are divisional rivals, the Rams (11-4) have now dropped to fifth in the seedings.

title: Seahawks‚Äô improbable overtime win over Rams is also an NFL first
description: The Seahawks completed an improbable comeback with an NFL first.
fullText:
The Seattle Seahawks pulled off an NFL first in their dramatic, improbable 38-37 win over the Los Angeles Rams on Thursday Night Football.

When Sam Darnold threw the decisive pass to Eric Saubert for the game‚Äôs final points, the Seahawks became the first team in NFL history to win an overtime game via two-point conversion.

DARNOLD. SAUBERT. @SEAHAWKS WIN! pic.twitter.com/VF2QElidFV

This year is the first season in which regular season overtime does not automatically end on an opening drive offensive touchdown. The only difference between regular season and playoff overtime (which eliminated ‚Äúoffensive touchdown on first possession wins the game‚Äù starting in the 2022 season) is that regular season OT is still just 10 minutes and not 15. Barring a defensive or special teams touchdown (or a safety), both offenses must possess the ball at least once.

The catalyst for this change was the famous Kansas City Chiefs vs. Buffalo Bills AFC Divisional playoff classic in the 201 season, in which Josh Allen never touched the ball in overtime and the Chiefs scored a touchdown on the first possession and never looked back.

While we‚Äôve yet to see an opening drive overtime touchdown under the current rules in the playoffs, this is the first time that a team has conceded an overtime touchdown and come back to win the game. The Jacksonville Jaguars scored a touchdown against the Las Vegas Raiders earlier this season, only for the Raiders to respond with their own. Geno Smith‚Äôs winning pass to Tyler Lockett was batted down and Jacksonville won.

It‚Äôs only fitting that such a weird thing would first be done by the Seahawks. We expect nothing less.

title: Rams' loss to Seahawks breaks NFL record that stood for at least 50 years
description: The Los Angeles Rams' Week 16 loss to the Seattle Seahawks saw the Rams break an NFL record that had stood for at least 50 years.
fullText:
Rams' Week 16 loss to Seahawks makes NFL history, ending 50-year streak originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Los Angeles Rams' Week 16 loss to the Seattle Seahawks was historic.

The Rams had everything going for them in the fourth quarter. They had a two-score lead and were dominating on both sides of the ball all night long.

But the Seahawks didn't quit and managed to rally over the final nine minutes to force the game into overtime, where Seattle again fell behind after a Rams touchdown on the opening possession of the extra frame.

Seattle came storming back, though, and scored its own touchdown before securing the victory with a two-point conversion.

With the loss, the Rams became the first team since at least 1975 to gain 400 yards or more, have zero giveaways, zero sacks taken and record three or more takeaways and still lose, according to NFL stats guru Dante Koplowitz-Fleming.

Previously, teams were 79-0 when hitting those marks.

The loss was enormous for the Rams, who now fall to second place in the NFC West and into the No. 5 seed in the conference.

Meanwhile, the Seahawks move into first place in the division and the No. 1 seed in the conference with two games left to play while also clinching a playoff berth.

But things are far from settled, as the Rams can still catch the Seahawks, and the same goes for the San Francisco 49ers.

The Niners will take the field on Monday night against the Indianapolis Colts.

Next week, the the Niners draw the Chicago Bears, while the Seahawks get the Carolina Panthers and the Rams face the Atlanta Falcons.

title: NFL Predictions: 3 Plus Money Bets to Target for Week 16
description: Targeting value in Week 16 NFL betting? We break down three plus-money predictions worth backing, with matchup analysis, betting angles, and odds insight.
fullText:
Plus-money props are where opportunity meets context, and this week offers plenty of both.

A rookie quarterback heading on the road is being undervalued by the market, while two proven veterans are playing with real money on the line as contract incentives come into focus.

Motivation, matchup, and usage all align to create outsized NFL picks at longer odds.

Since returning to the lineup, J.J. McCarthy looks rejuvenated, throwing five touchdown passes against vulnerable Washington and Dallas defenses. The Giants profile similarly when it comes to stopping offenses near the goal line, making this another spot where efficiency should show up on the scoreboard.

New York ranks bottom five in red-zone defense and is riding an eight-game losing skid, allowing 31.5 points per game. This is a defense that struggles to stop drives, and the Minnesota Vikings are well-positioned to take advantage. McCarthy has also shown he‚Äôs not afraid to push the ball downfield, ranking second in air yards per attempt while benefiting from the second-best protection rate in the league at 88 percent.

Minnesota‚Äôs red-zone tendencies further support the Over. The Vikings have been ineffective running the ball near the goal line to the point that C.J. Ham handled the short-yardage touchdown last week. As a result, Minnesota ranks among the most pass-heavy teams in the red zone. All signs point toward McCarthy clearing 1.5 passing touchdowns.

Stefon Diggs has incentive money firmly in play with three games remaining. He‚Äôs three receptions shy of a $500K bonus, and 13 catches away from another $500K, putting a total of $1 million on the line. Diggs has recorded at least three receptions in all but one game this season, but has been quieter recently in a pair of run-heavy matchups against the Bills and Giants.

That could change this week against Baltimore, a defense allowing the sixth-most receptions to wide receivers. If Diggs wants to make a real push toward that second incentive at 80 catches, the volume needs to start building now. With the Jets up next and a Week 18 matchup against Miami that could turn run-heavy if playoff positioning is settled, this sets up as a spot where Diggs is motivated, and the matchup finally cooperates.

Follow me here, because this angle makes sense. Nick Folk has been one of the most reliable kickers in the league, converting 96.2 percent of his attempts, the best mark in the NFL. This also happens to be his final indoor game of the season before trips to the Meadowlands and Orchard Park in Weeks 17 and 18, where kicking conditions become far less predictable.

Folk sits at 25 made field goals and has significant incentives in play, earning $375K at 27 makes and another $500K if he reaches 30. He kicks for an offense that struggles to finish drives and draws another favorable matchup against the Saints this week. Indoors, the leash is longer, and there‚Äôs a real chance the coaching staff is more aggressive with long attempts than they‚Äôd consider outdoors. Folk has missed just one kick all season and is 7-for-8 from 50-plus, which could turn a few borderline decisions into field goal tries with real incentive-driven upside.

title: Dallas Cowboys retain status as world's most valuable team
description: The Dallas Cowboys retain their status as the world's most valuable sports team in the annual Forbes list published on Thursday and dominated by NFL clubs.
fullText:
The Dallas Cowboys have retained their status as the world's most valuable sports team, topping Forbes' annual list that was published on Thursday and dominated by NFL clubs.

The Cowboys have led the rankings since 2016 when they overtook Spanish football club Real Madrid and were valued at $13bn (¬£9.7bn) - a 29% increase from last year.

NBA's Golden State Warriors came second with a valuation of $11bn (¬£8.2bn), followed by NFL duo Los Angeles Rams ($10.5bn/¬£7.8bn) and New York Giants ($10.1bn/¬£7.5bn), while another NBA side, the Los Angeles Lakers ($10bn/¬£7.5bn), completed the top five.

Only four football clubs - Real, Manchester United, Barcelona and Liverpool - feature in the latest top 50 list as Manchester City, Bayern Munich and Paris St-Germain dropped off after featuring in the 2024 edition.

title: Cleveland Browns have interest in hiring Bill Belichick, says NFL insider
description: The Browns reportedly have interest in Bill Belichick.
fullText:
Cleveland Browns have interest in hiring Bill Belichick, says NFL insider originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Should the Cleveland Browns lose their remaining three games, it will mark the second consecutive season in which they finished 3-14, meaning head coach Kevin Stefanski could certainly be on his way out.

Should the Browns decide to fire the two-time Coach of the Year, there are several names they could explore to make their next head coach. Brian Flores, Jesse Minter, and Chris Shula are all names to keep an eye on around the NFL. However, NFL insider Josina Anderson reports that there are multiple people in the Browns organization that would be interested in bringing in Bill Belichick.

"I'm told there's been recent interest expressed, at the very least, in speaking with Bill Belichick on a exploratory basis from two teams , per league source," Anderson reports on X. "My understanding is Belichick has upper-level personnel still fond of him in Atlanta, New York, Cleveland, whilst all struggling teams going through customary evaluations this time of year."

Belichick was the head coach of the Browns from 1991-95 before he was fired and the team moved to Baltimore. He then went to New England to join his former boss, Bill Parcells, as the Patriots' assistant head coach and defensive backs coach before leaving with Parcells and going to the New York Jets from 1997-99. When Parcells stepped down as head coach, Belichick was named the new head coach before infamously resigning and going back to New England, going on to win six Super Bowls. He is currently the head coach at the University of North Carolina.

title: Why are there three NFL games on Christmas Day?
description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why there are three NFL matches on Christmas Day this year
fullText:
The NFL has held at least one match on Christmas Day every year since 2020, with three 25 December fixtures scheduled in 2025.

It has previously held matches on the holiday, but between 1989 and 2019 would only occasionally schedule regular-season games on that date. This only tended to take place in years when Christmas Day would fall on a Friday, Saturday or Sunday.

Earlier this season, NFL commissioner Roger Goodell confirmed that from this year onwards there would be three games held every year on 25 December.

Since 2021, two or three games have taken place on Christmas Day each year, with this year being a three-game day, much like in 2022 and 2023.

All three Christmas Day matches are between teams that have strong rivalries.

The Washington Commanders will host the Dallas Cowboys in the first game of the day, with the Minnesota Vikings playing at home against the Detroit Lions in the second.

In the third and final game of the day the Kansas City Chiefs face the Denver Broncos.

While all three games kick off on Christmas Day in America, because of time zone differences the Chiefs-Broncos game will actually start in the early hours of 26 December at 01:15 GMT.

Streaming site Netflix will show the first two games, as it did in 2024. The third match will be shown on Prime Video.

In 1971, the NFL held its first two Christmas Day matches following the merger between the American Football League and National Football League in the previous year.

Those two matches were play-off games and the unpopularity of the decision to host the Christmas Day double-header led to an 18-year gap before matches were played again on 25 December.

title: Rams vs Seahawks Prediction, Picks & Best Bets for Thursday Night Football Week 16
description: Rams vs. Seahawks predictions and NFL picks for Thursday Night Football. Los Angeles stays a step ahead of Seattle.
fullText:
The top spot in the NFC is on the line when the Los Angeles Rams and Seattle Seahawks face off in a heavyweight Thursday Night Football matchup.

My Rams vs Seahawks predictions and NFL picks side with the visiting Rams, who have a lot of betting trends on their side.

Kickoff is set for 8:15 p.m. ET from Lumen Field in beautiful Seattle, with the game airing on Prime Video on Thursday, December 18.

Rams vs Seahawks best bet: Rams -1 (-105)

I like backing betting trends, so it‚Äôs near impossible to overlook the Los Angeles Rams in this spot at a reasonable number.

Los Angeles has been one of the most reliable late-season bets in the NFL, compiling a 17‚Äì3 ATS record in their last 20 games played in the month of December. That trend has continued this year, with the Rams starting December 2‚Äì0 while piling up 86 total points against Arizona and Detroit, surpassing 500 yards of offense in both games. They‚Äôre peaking at the right time.

They‚Äôve also dominated the spread in matchups against the Seattle Seahawks, covering 11 of the last 14 meetings, including five straight at Lumen Field. That level of consistency against a division opponent is hard to dismiss, particularly in a building that‚Äôs traditionally been difficult for visitors.

Road performance has also been a strength. Los Angeles has gone 11‚Äì2 ATS in its last 13 road games and owns a 17‚Äì5 ATS mark overall since December 1 of last season. Whether home or away, this team has shown an ability to travel and execute in high-leverage spots.

Even setting trends aside, there are reasons for skepticism on the Seattle side.

The Seahawks escaped with a narrow win over the Philip Rivers-led Colts last week despite being nearly two-touchdown favorites, and while they continue to accumulate wins, Sam Darnold‚Äôs play has cooled off. It‚Äôs also very fair to question his confidence in standalone, high-pressure games after he completely melted down at the end of last season with the Vikings.

That concern is amplified by the matchup itself. The Rams are 3‚Äì0 against Darnold since the start of last season and forced him into costly mistakes, including a four-interception performance just over a month ago.

Trends alone don‚Äôt decide games, but when form, matchup history, and quarterback results all point in the same direction, they deserve attention. On a short week in Seattle, the data suggests the Rams are once again positioned to continue their strong December run.

In addition to being 3-0 vs Darnold since the beginning of last season, Los Angeles has owned the Seahawks, going 11-3 ATS against them in the last 14 matchups. Look for Kyren Williams to add to his 13 total TDs vs. a Seattle defense that's allowed the most receptions in the NFL to opposing running backs.

Kyren Williams anytime touchdown

Kyren Williams Over 1.5 receptions

JSN has reached the 100-yard mark in an amazing eight of his last 10 games, including going for 105 vs. the Rams on November 15. Los Angeles has allowed the sixth-most receiving yards to the wide receiver position this season.

Kyren Williams anytime touchdown

Kyren Williams Over 1.5 receptions

Jaxon Smith-Njigba Over 95.5 receiving yards

The Rams have hit their stride during the stretch run of the season with back-to-back wins where they‚Äôve dropped 40+ points and 500+ yards. I‚Äôm not going to stand in front of that vs Darnold, who can‚Äôt be trusted in big spots like this.

With the Rams being 17-3 ATS in their last 20 games played in December while also being 11-3 ATS in their last 14 games vs the Seahawks, I‚Äôll happily side with them to cover.

The Under also profiles well in a matchup between two of the league‚Äôs top defenses. These teams rank second and third in points allowed and played to a 21‚Äì19 game in November that was tracking even lower before late touchdowns. Unless short fields or defensive scores swing the script, the metrics point toward a lower-scoring game.

title: Why 2025 feels like NFL 'snow globe's been shaken'
description: The Kansas City Chiefs have made an early exit from the NFL play-off race, leaving the road to the Super Bowl open. Who are the pretenders to their throne?
fullText:
Patrick Mahomes' knee injury could barely have been more symbolic for the Kansas City Chiefs.

The three-time Super Bowl winner was battling to save his team's season when he was forced off late in Sunday's game against the Los Angeles Chargers.

Moments later, the Chargers clinched victory to seal the Chiefs' fate. For the first time in 11 seasons, Kansas City will not feature in the NFL play-offs.

Their leader is fallen, their dynasty is crumbling, but during a topsy-turvy season, no one team has emerged as their likely successor.

The Chiefs' early exit from the play-off race has left this season's NFL title up for grabs, with several pretenders to the throne.

title: NFL Mock Draft 2026: Jets opt for Oregon's Dante Moore, Chiefs replace Travis Kelce and Ohio State owns Round 1
description: In Sporting News' fourth edition of first-round projections for the 2026 NFL Draft, five Buckeyes and two Ducks go from Big Ten playoff teams, along with Indiana QB Fernando Mendoza. Miami, Texas Tech, Georgia, Alabama and Texas A&M are also well represented from the CFP.
fullText:
NFL Mock Draft 2026: Jets opt for Oregon's Dante Moore, Chiefs replace Travis Kelce and Ohio State owns Round 1 originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The College Football Playoff will feature plenty of great future NFL talent with the 12 teams making the field. While it might not be surprising Ohio State's loaded team dominates the pro prospects, 18 of Sporting News' 32 first-round projections in all are tied to CFP action.

The Buckeyes lead with five such picks, with Georgia, Oregon, Texas A&M, Alabama and Miami also in line to have multiple selections on Day 1. Indiana, Oklahoma and Texas Tech get on the board, too. That's incredible representation from three-fourths of the CFP teams, which also account for all three QBs and four of the first five overall picks.

Here is the Sporting News' latest NFL Mock Draft ahead of the 2025 College Football playoff.

MORE: Bills, 49ers rise as Packers fade in latest SN Power Rankings

(No. 1-18 order courtesy of Tankathon; No. 19-32 from Week 16 playoff picture)

Arvell Reese, LB, Ohio State (6-4, 243 pounds)

The Giants, if they stay at No. 1 overall and don't trade out of this pick for a team wanting a quarterback, should consider taking Reese as an all-around force to fix a lot of their defensive issues away from a rather productive pass rush.

Fernando Mendoza, QB, Indiana (6-5, 225 pounds)

The Raiders can't be happy with their quarterback situation post-Derek Carr, with Geno Smith and Kenny Pickett screaming that they need to go after a true, strong, accurate franchise passer solution. Mendoza looks the part with his arm and intangibles, two things that should appeal to the influence of Tom Brady.

Rueben Bain Jr., EDGE, Miami (6-3, 275 pounds)

The Titans also don't need a QB after taking Cam Ward No. 1 overall last year, but they can go back to the Hurricanes program to get the game-changing pass-rusher they desperately need for their latest defensive reboot.

Jordyn Tyson, WR, Arizona State (6-2, 200 pounds)

The Browns need to stop messing around at wide receiver and give either Shedeur Sanders or a different starting quarterback a true go-to all over the field, both in the slot and outside, in Amon-Ra St. Brown and Jaxon Smith-Njigba vein, only lacking the hyphen.

Dante Moore, QB, Oregon (6-3, 206 pounds)

Moore has the leadership and intangibles to handle being the next shot at a franchise QB in New York as well as the savvy and strong arm. They also need to get a real long-term option after the Justin Fields flop.

Troy Wayrynen/USA TODAY Network

Jeremiyah Love, RB, Notre Dame (6-0, 214 pounds)

The Cardinals saw the breakdown early of pending free agent James Conner and have had an unhealthy mess of a committee trying to replace him. This may seem like a luxury pick for a team that has a lot of needs, but they can get some tackle help later and Love can be a game-changer for restoring balance and expanding the explosiveness.

Makai Lemon, WR, USC (5-11, 195 pounds)

The Saints, should they stick with Tyler Shough at QB, need to give him more weapons after depleting the receiving crops beyond Chris Olave. Kellen Moore can have some visions of Lemon being the DeVonta Smith to Olave's A.J. Brown should Shough show big improvement.

MORE:¬†Sporting News' expert predictions for 2025 College Football Playoff

Caleb Downs, S, Ohio State (6-0, 205 pounds)

The Commanders need to get younger and more impactful in their defense after things fell apart in their secondary and around Bobby Wagner at linebacker. Downs is a terrific do-everything hybrid who would be set up to make a lot of big plays in Dan Quinn's scheme.

Peter Woods, DT, Clemson (6-3, 315 pounds)

The Bengals need to keep beefing up their defensive line to pull out of being atrocious against the run and it doesn't hurt to have some of Woods' inside pass-rush juice to support their end rotation.

Jermod McCoy, CB, Tennessee (6-0, 193 pounds)

The Rams know that cornerback coverage is their biggest weakness on an otherwise loaded roster, with some retooling needed. They keep up the strong defensive pick momentum with the nice-sized, tough McCoy.

Francis Mauigoa, OT, Miami (6-6, 315 pounds)

The Dolphins need to get more offensive line help for wherever they go at QB and they can stay in town to get a long-term all-around rock in Mauigoa.

Kenyon Sadiq, TE, Oregon (6-3, 245 pounds)

The Chiefs need to be feeling the imminence of Travis Kelce's retirement and can step right into drafting his dynamic go-to receiver replacement to boost Patrick Mahomes again once he returns from his torn ACL.

MORE:¬†Why it's not time to announce the Chiefs dynasty over yet

Mansoor Delane, CB, LSU (6-0, 190 pounds)

The Vikings will need to keep working on their secondary with some contract issues ahead and Delane is not that far off in battling McCoy for the status as the best corner in this class.

David Bailey, EDGE, Texas Tech (6-3, 250 pounds)

The Cowboys will go to work on replacing Micah Parsons' pass rush production with this Lubbock chess piece who has all the moves to get to the quarterback as well as unique dropback coverage ability for the position.

Keldric Faulk, EDGE, Auburn (6-6, 285 pounds)

The Ravens should love this complete outside linebacker option who can provide power vs. the run as well as needed pass-rush juice.

Sonny Styles, LB, Ohio State (6-4, 243 pounds)

The Panthers have been feeling the void at linebacker for a while after it was once a strength and GM Dan Morgan should have intrigue to go for his former position with Styles, a versatile talent who makes a lot of plays everywhere along with Reese.

Cashius Howell, EDGE, Texas A&M (6-2, 248 pounds)

Howell can give the Lions the needed strong complementary pass rusher for Aidan Hutchinson to relieve their secondary coverage a lot more next season.

Avieon Terrell, CB, Clemson (5-11, 180 pounds)

The Jets, after going QB with Moore earlier in this mock, can get their Sauce Gardner replacement with the pick acquired in that trade with Terrell, brother of Falcons star A.J.

Spencer Fano, OT, Utah (6-6, 302 pounds)

The Texans have gotten surprising returns from rookie Aireontay Ersery and the rest of their rebuilt line but should be in the market to boost pass protection and run blocking at either right tackle or guard with Fano.

T.J. Parker, EDGE, Clemson (6-3, 265 pounds)

The Cowboys shouldn't mind doubling up on pass-rush help here with Parker and Bailey, as Parker can provide more traditional burst and finishing moves from defensive end to help Quinnen Williams in Matt Eberflus' front four.

Carnell Tate, WR, Ohio State (6-3, 195 pounds)

The 49ers seem ready to cut ties with injured Brandon Aiyuk, which means they will need to find a dynamic speedy big target for Brock Purdy to better take advantage of his ace deep passing. Tate would be a natural fit with George Kittle and Jauan Jennings downfield.

Kayden McDonald, DT, Ohio State (6-3, 326 pounds)

The Bills have been terrible against the run and McDonald is a natural and physically overwhelming run-stopper for the Buckeyes, shooting up boards with his dominant play fron the regular season.

Caleb Banks, DT, Florida (6-6, 330 pounds)

The Chargers also could bolster their interior to help their front seven in multiple ways and Banks has the right kind of power and pop for Jesse Minter.

Brandon Cisse, CB, South Carolina (6-0, 190 pounds)

The Seahawks didn't trade pending free agent Riq Woolen and will need to find their strong replacement outside to support Devon Witherpoon. Cissee can be seamless in the schme of Mike Macdonald.

R Mason Thomas, EDGE, Oklahoma (6-2, 249 pounds)

The Buccaneers should covet this explosive pass-rusher built to thrive in Todd Bowles' scheme and help restore their old strength on the second level.

Ty Simpson, QB, Alabama (6-2, 208 pounds)s

The Steelers should be in the market for a starting QB early if Aaron Rodgers retires and Simpson's brand of pocket passing would provide plenty of promise.

Olaivavega Ioane, G, Penn State (6-4, 330 pounds)

The Eagles have had issues at right guard this season and Ioane would be the easy upgrade coming from State College to Philly. sliding over from his left side position in college to start right away and upgrade over Tyler Steen.

Caleb Lomu, OT, Utah (6-6, 304 pounds)

The Browns need to rebuild their offensive line right up there with getting more reliable receivers and Lomu would be a good initial building block, going not long after teammate Fano.

Christen Miller, DT, Georgia (6-3, 305 pounds)

The Bears need to work on their interior for Dennis Allen's front and Miller would be ideal to help them with their own run-stopping problems.

KC Concepcion, WR, Texas A&M (5-11, 190 pounds)

The Patriots should love what this dynamic slot can do as the ideal fit in Josh McDaniels' offense to make big plays in the open field after the catch and upgrade over Pop Douglas and other complements to Stefon Diggs.

MORE:¬†Updated list of every college coaching change for 2026

Kadyn Proctor, OT, Alabama (6-7, 366 pounds)

The Rams can again think more about the near future with this second first-rounder with Proctor looking solid as their future long-term tackle on either the right or left side.

C.J. Allen, LB, Georgia (6-1, 235 pounds)

The Broncos need to cover more ground defensively on the second level and Allen would provide that typical Bulldogs athlete who can get around well vs. run and in coverage.

title: NFL Writer Names ‚ÄòDream Scenario‚Äô For Rest Of Patriots Season
description: The Patriots suffered a defeat against the Buffalo Bills on Sunday, but their chances of securing the AFC East title remain promising. New England still has three regular season games remaining, playing the Baltimore Ravens, New York Jets and Miami Dolphins. Brad Gagnon from Bleacher Report outlined the Patriots‚Äô ideal scenario for the remainder of [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The Patriots suffered a defeat against the Buffalo Bills on Sunday, but their chances of securing the AFC East title remain promising.

New England still has three regular season games remaining, playing the Baltimore Ravens, New York Jets and Miami Dolphins.

Brad Gagnon from Bleacher Report outlined the Patriots‚Äô ideal scenario for the remainder of the regular season.

‚ÄúBeat the Ravens on the road in Week 16 to show some much-needed resiliency, then clinch the AFC East title by taking care of the division-rival Jets and/or Dolphins to close out the regular season,‚Äù Gagnon wrote on Wednesday.

The Patriots can secure a playoff spot with a win or a tie against the Ravens this Sunday. However, New England will need to wait for the outcome of the last two weeks, which will be determined by division opponents, to see if it can clinch the AFC East title.

New England currently has an 11-3 record, while Buffalo is at 10-4. If the Patriots win their remaining games, they will secure the AFC East title. However, after losing to Buffalo in Week 15, they lost the head-to-head tiebreaker, as the Patriots and Bills split their matchups this season.

The next tiebreaker is based on wins against division opponents. The Patriots have a 3-1 record, while the Bills are 3-2 following their loss to the Dolphins.

Even if the Patriots lose to the Ravens but defeat the Jets and Dolphins, New England will still claim the AFC East title, even if the Bills win all their remaining games.

title: Travis Kelce Breaks Silence on Patrick Mahomes‚Äô ACL Injury, Chiefs‚Äô Future
description: Travis Kelce entered the 2025-‚Äô26 NFL season looking to win a fourth Super Bowl with Patrick Mahomes and the Kansas [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Travis Kelce entered the 2025-‚Äô26 NFL season looking to win a fourth Super Bowl with Patrick Mahomes and the Kansas City Chiefs, but it all fell apart in Week 15. In the fourth quarter against the Los Angeles Chargers, Mahomes suffered a season-ending torn ACL. The Chiefs lost 16-13 and were eliminated from playoff contention.

It was a very disappointing season for Kansas City as the offense never found a consistent rhythm, even with Mahomes and Kelce playing really well. Following the game, the Chiefs‚Äô tight end refused to speak to the media, citing that it wasn‚Äôt the right time.

Now, Kelce has broken his silence on Mahomes‚Äô brutal ACL injury, while sending a possible hint on his future with the Chiefs.

On Wednesday, Jason and Travis Kelce released their ‚ÄúNew Heights‚Äù podcast after Week 15. Many were waiting to hear what the Kansas City tight end was going to say about Mahomes, but they didn‚Äôt expect the possible hint about his future.

‚Äú[Patrick Mahomes] is a fearless, fearless warrior when it comes to this football thing,‚Äù Kelce said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs gonna make sure that he comes back stronger than ever. Hopefully, the Chiefs can get him back as soon as possible. I know right now it‚Äôs kind of right around that, Week 1 or the beginning of the season next year. I know he‚Äôs going to be doing everything he can to get back out on that field for the Chiefs as soon as possible.‚Äù

Kelce‚Äôs decision to say ‚Äúthe Chiefs‚Äù instead of ‚Äúwe‚Äù has stirred up some discussion on social media that he has already made up his mind about retirement. In the midst of a tough 2025 NFL season, it is not shocking to hear that Kelce might have already made up his mind after coming off a loss in the Super Bowl.

If so, this means that Kelce has caught his final pass from Mahomes, as Gardner Minshew appears to be the starting quarterback for the rest of the NFL season. Based on Kelce‚Äôs comments, it seems like these will be his final three games in the NFL before entering retirement as well.
